concept.title: Planning
concept.shortdesc: When you plan your solution, you must make a number of decisions to ensure your solution works effectively.

dlentry.dd: Messaging patterns identify common message flows used in messaging solutions. You can use the messaging patterns to identify your messaging needs, and use the associated scenarios to get started quickly. For more information about the messaging patterns, see .

A number of factors can affect the message throughput of the appliance.
Publishers An increase in the number of incoming connections from application clients that are publishing messages might result in a decrease in the rate of message throughput.
Number of topics Using a small number of topics might limit throughput.
Network interface card To improve message throughput, you might want publishers and subscribers to connect to the appliance on different network interface cards. For example, you might configure your solution so that publishers connect to an endpoint defined on the eth6 interface, and subscribers connect to an endpoint defined on the eth7 interface.

High availability (HA) is the ability of messaging services to withstand an outage of an appliance and continue to provide messaging services.
